revised_title: Reactivity of Freshly Reduced Hemoglobin: A Study on the Kinetics of Hemoglobin
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the reactivity of freshly reduced hemoglobin and found that it reacts faster with carbon monoxide than older hemoglobin molecules. They also discovered that the difference in reactivity does not depend on the age of oxyhemoglobin from which it is formed, provided it is older than 0.1 second. This research helps to understand the kinetics of hemoglobin and its role in blood gas reactions.
